abstract: Bank of America chief Kenneth D. Lewis was approached by former Merrill Lynch executives to discuss buying back some of their old company, but he politely rebuffed them, The Financial Times reported.
snippet: Bank of America chief Kenneth D. Lewis was approached by former Merrill Lynch executives to discuss buying back some of their old company, but he politely rebuffed them, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America Chief Executive Kenneth D. Lewis was approached by three former Merrill Lynch executives this year to discuss buying back some or all of their old company, but he politely declined to sell, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: Ex-Merrill Execs Wanted to Buy It Back, Report Says
